title: Wirecast PRO 6.0.23430 (x86/x64) Final Incl. Patch-DVT [ATOM]
description:
Description:
Wirecast is a unique and cross-platform webcasting utility that provides support for multiple webcams (including iSight), amazing 3D graphics, over 20 built-in professional broadcast quality titles themes, a simple interface, and video effects.

Wirecast also offers you Keynote integration, multiple layers, multiple broadcast support, broadcast archiving, and AppleScript support.

Wirecast comes with a new concept of "shots" that can be used to quickly group up your selected cameras, movies, graphical overlays, and titles into a single object. Once your list of shot is built your, you can easily transition the broadcast between them with a single mouse click.

Real-time broadcast controlling is also really easy using Wirecast's multiple layer support. This feature makes simple to place a company logo or a background music track over your webcast, while swiftly changing between the cameras you want your viewers to see.


Features:
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Support DV, HDV (1) and USB cameras
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Real-time transition and effect generator
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Built-in GPU accelerated green and blue screen solution
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Professional broadcast quality titles themes.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Generates fully ISO-compliant MPEG-4 video streams
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢GPU accelerated Core Image filter and transition library
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Keynote integration
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢H.264 video codec support
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Multi-language


What's New: 

Fixes and Enhancements:
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Instant Replay support. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Playlist Support. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Twitter integration. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Support for the new iOS 8 App, Wirecast Cam, as a camera source. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Recordings are now written in a recoverable file format. Recording files are now usable even the recording is interrupted due to system failure. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Full Retina support. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Improved Multicast and Unicast support. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Keyboard mapping functionality for shots. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Shortcut keys for setting in and out points and creating Replay shots. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Destination for Microsoft Azure Media Services. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Destination for Wowza Streaming Engine (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Added AppleScript samples to application bundle. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Added the ability to play back recorded media in Preview. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Added the ability to set in and out points in Preview. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Added the ability to set playback speed in Preview. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Added the ability to suppress automatic detection of IP devices in network. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Added the ability to automatically set the Canvas size. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Support for using custom backgrounds for Scoreboards. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Hotkeys to change scores from the Wirecast main window. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Add support for 2K and 4K canvas sizes via Custom Canvas size. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! AppleScript examples are now part of the application bundle at Wirecast.app/Contents/Resources/scriptingexamples. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! 64bit versions of Wirecast are now available. Moving to 64bit fixes many problems caused by running out of memory due to 32bit memory limits. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Updated installer technology for Windows;; new versions of Wirecast will automatically replace previous versions of Wirecast without the need to manually uninstall beforehand. (Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Dedicated destination for Wowza server that can utilize configuration files created by Wowza. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! MOV record to disk destination replaces QuickTime Record To Disk for recording near lossless video at low CPU. ProRes codec is available on Mac, and MJPEG is available on Windows with selectable quality. (Mac OS X & Windows). 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Wirecast no longer uses QuickTime components for video file playback and writing. QuickTime, deprecated by Apple, has been replaced with technology optimized to take advantage of 64 bit addressing, providing superior performance with higher resolutions and frame rates. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! QuickTime is no longer required to run Wirecast on Windows. (Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! User presets are now listed on top of system, and destination default presets for easy access. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! Ability to set the maximum number of reconnects to a streaming server/CDN. This avoids the situation where a user would have to force quite Wirecast once a server becomes unresponsive. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New! New Blue Pro Titler Plug-in and support (Mac OS X & Windows) 

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Eliminated memory spike when playing back some mp4 files. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed problem where some mp4 files would play back with no audio. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed issue where incorrect Video FPS selections were displayed for USB cameras in the Source Settings dialog. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed jitter/stutter when recording at 1080p in ProRes and MJPEG. (Mac OS X, Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed issue that prevented tabbing between controls. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed issue that sometimes caused frame drops during a transition when switching to shots containing prerecorded video. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed problem where streaming audio-only resulted in sped up audio. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed problem where audio because out of sync after playing video file in the Configure Media Settings tab of the Shot Editor. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed issue where disconnecting a device could cause a crash if there were no built-in AV devices or other AV devices connected to the system. (Mac OS X, Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed crash when last connected camera was disconnected. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed crash on exit after using Blackmagic Output and Input on separate cards. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed problem where Bonjour WebStream sources did not connect and the Asset Manager listed them as missing at document load. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed issue that caused floating colors in scoreboards. (Mac OS X) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed memory leak and eventual crash (after a few hours) when using the Matrox VS4. (Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed issue that caused black frames to be inserted during transitions. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed issue that prevented a correct event list to be retrieved from YouTube. (Mac OS X & Windows) 

Features No Longer Supported:
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ VP6 codec no longer supported and has been replaced for streaming in Flash by H.264. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Streaming to a QuickTime streaming server. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Streaming using the built-in QuickTime streaming server. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Playback of animated GIFs that was supported via QuickTime. ProRes may be used as an alternative. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Support for Apple Animation. (Mac OS X & Windows) 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The Sony SNC-RZ50. (Mac OS X & Windows)
